title: Imperial County MEHKO
description: Home-based restaurant permit for up to 30 meals/day or 90 meals/week, max $100,000 annual sales. Same-day prep/cook/serve; delivery by operator/household allowed.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Confirm you can run a MEHKO at home and understand limits.

**Why it matters:** You must operate within MEHKO rules to be approved and compliant.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Residence in Imperial County
- ☐ Menu and daily/weekly production plan (≤30/day, ≤90/week)
- ☐ Kitchen setup meeting food safety practices

**Where/how:** Review ICPHD’s MEHKO page and guidelines.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 10–30 minutes

**Ready when:** You can state your volume within limits.

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get a Food Protection Manager certificate and food handler cards for helpers.

**Why it matters:** Required by ICPHD for permitting.

**What you need:**
- ☐ CFPM certificate (ANSI-CFP)
- ☐ Food handler certificates (any helpers)
- ☐ Landlord/HOA OK if applicable

**Where/how:** Take ANSI-approved training; gather documents.

**Cost & time:** ~$60–$90 · 1–2 days

**Ready when:** Certificates are ready to attach.

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
**What to do:** Assemble all items for your packet.

**Why it matters:** Incomplete packets delay inspection.

**What you need:**
- ☐ SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ Health Permit Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ Menu and ID (with MEHKO address)

**Where/how:** Follow ICPHD’s guidelines & FAQs.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** All documents are filled/signed as PDFs.

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the SOP form covering menu, prep, storage, sanitation, and service/delivery.

**Why it matters:** Shows ICPHD how you will operate safely.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Menu and ingredients list
- ☐ Cooking/cooling/holding details
- ☐ Cleaning/sanitizing plan; thermometer

**Where/how:** Fill this SOP and attach required items.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** SOP is complete and consistent with your operation.

steps.title: Health Permit Application
steps.content:
**What to do:** Fill the county Food Facility Health Permit Application (select MEHKO type).

**Why it matters:** Official request for a MEHKO permit.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Owner/site info; contact email
- ☐ Operation details (select MEHKO)
- ☐ SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)

**Where/how:** Complete and sign this application.

**Cost & time:** $0 to fill · 15–30 minutes

**Ready when:** Application is complete and matches your SOP.

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees
steps.content:
**What to do:** Submit your packet and pay fees.

**Why it matters:** Processing and inspection scheduling start after payment.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Completed Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ Completed SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ Menu and ID copies
- ☐ Payment method

**Where/how:** Imperial County Public Health Department, Environmental Health Division, 797 Main St, Suite B, El Centro, CA 92243 · (442) 265-1888 · www.icphd.org.

**Cost & time:** Annual Health Permit $370 (MEHKO) · other fees per schedule · 10–20 minutes to submit

**Ready when:** ICPHD confirms receipt and payment.

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
**What to do:** Coordinate your in-home inspection with ICPHD.

**Why it matters:** Required prior to operation; annual routine thereafter.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Kitchen ready per SOP
- ☐ Thermometer, sanitizer, handwash setup
- ☐ Equipment functional

**Where/how:** ICPHD schedules after review/payment.

**Cost & time:** Included in permit fee · ~1–2 hours

**Ready when:** You pass and resolve any corrections.

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
**What to do:** Obtain your MEHKO permit and keep it available.

**Why it matters:** You must have a valid permit to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Approval notice
- ☐ Permit document

**Where/how:** Issued by ICPHD after passing inspection.

**Cost & time:** $0 after fees

**Ready when:** Permit is issued and on hand.

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
**What to do:** Follow your SOP; keep within meal/sales limits; renew annually.

**Why it matters:** Maintains permit and protects customers.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Meal logs ≤30/day, ≤90/week
- ☐ Temperature/cleaning records
- ☐ Renewal reminder

**Where/how:** Maintain simple records; consult ICPHD guidelines & FAQs.

**Cost & time:** Annual $370 · ongoing

**Ready when:** Records maintained and renewal on time.

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**What to do:** Use ICPHD contact for help.

**Why it matters:** Staff can answer county-specific questions.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Phone/email
- ☐ Office address and hours
- ☐ Website

**Where/how:** ICPHD Environmental Health — 797 Main St, Suite B, El Centro, CA 92243 · Phone (442) 265-1888 · Website icphd.org.

**Cost & time:** $0 · varies

**Ready when:** You have what you need to proceed.
